page.title: 01BARTON-LE-CLAY
page.content: The full name of the village of Barton is Barton-le-Clay, so named because it lies on a ridge of Gault Clay. This part of the village is mainly modern estates, mostly built in the 1960s and later to typical estate styles. The main road through the village, the A6, suffers from very heavy traffic flows. Barton is the only settlement between Bedford and Luton not to be by-passed. The architecture in Bedford Road is very mixed with much adaptation of older residential buildings to commercial premises. In addition, there has been modern infilling giving a very unbalanced appearance to the view most travellers have of the village.
